Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel with roud staffs”
Reviews.Author: Mgholamii
Reviews.Content: because of some elevator 's we had to change there hotel. They didn't say any excuse TheStaffs were roud & impolite

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay near everything”
Reviews.Author: Ed-Janice S
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed @ this hotel 7 nights and we were VERY happy with it. The room wasn't huge but it didn't need to be. The breakfast was EXCELLENT. The people were very nice especially Andrae(worked at night), the cleaning lady & the lady who took care of the breakfast. We would recommend this place and we would certainly stay there again if we were in the area. It was close to everything so easily walkable to all of our sites. Train statin & busing 5 minutes away & restaurante's all over. There are even 2 supermarkets close by. Very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel near termini station”
Reviews.Author: Costas V
Reviews.Content: we stayed at georgi hotel for 3 nights. we were very satisfied from our stay there, it is a clean hotel with a good breakfast in a good location near termini station. there are some good restaurant nearby and the staff of the hotel are friendly especially the gentleman at night who speaks 4-5 languages.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousUS88
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed 4 nights at this hotel and found it to fit our needs. It is about a 5 minute walk to the train station, but still a 30 minute walk to any of the sights. It was easy to find since I saw the picture of the outside while looking at reviews on this site. The room was a good size, but when we went to our first room the door did not lock. Our key did not work but we just pushed the door and it opened. They used the key cards. We went back down and the receptionist checked to see the issue and gave us a new room right next door immediately. That same day he had a repair guy fix the door. The shower was less impressive compared to all the other hotels we stayed at in Italy. It had no pressure and was almost cold by the time it got to you. We went in December so the heaters were on. It got very hot and there was no manual thermostat. We had to call down to the front to turn it off each day we returned in the afternoon. Breakfast was comparable to other hotels we were at, which we enjoyed. The wi-fi only worked in the common area and worked very poorly. Overall, the hotel was decent. I don't think I would return tho.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and very dusty room”
Reviews.Author: BartQS
Reviews.Content: The service on reception was really unwelcoming here and our rooms were not very nice at all. My room was very dusty and left me feeling unfresh in the morning and my friends room had a radiator that would not turn off so they had to sleep with the window open which was not ideal given that it was below freezing outside.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: chiyo_m
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel fof 3days,and I thught that I made good choice. Staffs will welcome warmly,and remenber you. So it would be helpful for you. My room was 106,there is small but clean and enough for me. Breakfast is good(cheese ,hum , kinds of bread and coffee ... and so on). I'm satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Shipped here from Milani, much better”
Reviews.Author: Nims22
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the Hotel Milani across the street, we were sent over to Hotel Giorgi instead. We were a little weirded out at first, but apparently they're owned by the same people so we were ok with that. To be honest, the Giorgi was so much better than the Milani, which we had stayed at earlier in our stay. Everything was very basic, plus we had a room with a balcony. They layout was a little weird, having to take two elevators (one ancient one that was incredibly rickety and nothing more than a cage with a wooden box, with all of the controls on a wood block nailed to the wall) to get to our room. Be careful, though, because if someone on another floor doesn't close the elevator door, you'll be stuck walking. Breakfast was meager at best, but the man that worked the desk was very nice. The location was great, right around the corner from Termini station and walking distance to everything else, so we'd likely book there again, providing we could be guaranteed not to be sent to the Milani.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I stayed while in Italy”
Reviews.Author: kaydee7
Reviews.Content: I don't know what hotel the bedroom photos are from on this website, but they look nothing like the room I stayed in at this hotel! I was in a single, Room 306. Avoid this room!! Smallest room I've ever stayed in. No outlets for converter. Floor is vinyl tiles circa 1965. The room was constantly hot and I never slept with covers. The one bright spot was that the bath was reasonably clean. The front desk staff is rude. I had to pick up tickets to a papal audience at a local church by 8:15 one morning so I left a 7 a.m. wake-up call. It never came. I woke up at 8:13 and missed getting my ticket. Thank goodness the Swiss guards at the Vatican took pity on me and let me in anyway. Somebody else posted that the WiFi is free. Um, no it's not. It's not expensive but it's not free. While close to Termini, it's not close to anything else. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Management”
Reviews.Author: GlinnieB
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently situated. The management is rude and unhelpful. Apparantly his name is Carmello.....what a nasty little man.... We had a fab visit and will definately return to Rome but never to the Hotel Giorgi again.

Reviews.Title: “A decent little economy hotel in a convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Mikenmar22000
Reviews.Content: Let me stress this is a budget hotel. We went into it expecting this. The room was clean. The front desk clerk was very friendly (but the clerk spoke quickly and his english was marginal so at times was a bit of a challenge to understand). The room was small but this is typical of Rome. If you want air conditioning you have to call the front desk to get it turned on which is a bit unusual but no problem if you are aware of it. The shower stall was the smallest I'd seen so wouldn't recommend for someone of wide carriage. Overall, the room was what we expected from a budget hotel and the customer service was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Jefflev13
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst hotel I ever stayed at. Mold in the shower, AC hardly worked, shower head was half clogged. When brought to the attention of the management they were rude, and told us it was a "beautiful" room. Maybe mold is beautiful in your world, but not mine. My travel agent called from the US, and when expressed his concerns, they hung up on him. They sent a service guy up to the room who tried to clean the mold up with some toilet paper, yes, toilet paper. They were so unpleasant to my daughter she walked out the back entrance to avoid this guy, Andrea his name was.What a jerk. This guy needs to find another line of work. This place is a joke, and anyone who stays here after reading this deserves what they get.

Reviews.Title: “Will never risk booking this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aussietraveller096
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Giorgi for approximately $180AUD per night and when we arrived late at night to check in and they said that there was a mistake with their reservation system and overbooked. So we were sent to another hotel, a good 6 - 7 min walk with luggage - Hotel Lux which they stressed was a 4 star hotel with complimentary breakfast. The breakfast was stale, rooms were so small that you can't walk if you have luggage, moldy ceilings, no internet, everything was broken and falling apart and there was never any hot water. Even though we never had the privilege of staying at Hotel Giorgi it says a lot about their service.... What kind of hotel makes a mistake and then books us a room in a run down hotel that can't possibly have even 1 star to their name?! They didn't know the address of Hotel Lux either and didn't help us get their besides using verbal directions.They made no attempt in contacting us before we check in regarding this mistake. If a hotel makes a mistake they are suppose to find a replacement hotel of similar or better quality and service and if Hotel Lux was their choice then Hotel Giorgi must be terrible as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: sgalexang
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights during our visit to The Eternal City. The hotel is very near to Termini Station which is a plus to us. It also comes with free wifi and breakfast for the price. The room is cozy and very comfortable which is nice. The staffs are very helpful too! The only not so nice thing is getting to my room at 3rd level using the lift. The lift from the reception to the 1st level is still ok. But as mentioned by another reviewer, the old cage lift is needed to get to 3rd level. And it is so small that after my wife and our 2 luggages are in the lift, there is no more space for me and I have to take the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, Quaint with potential. Excellent location close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: kalyngra
Reviews.Content: Bit of a shock when you do arrive at this Hotel. Front door is really just a doorway in a narrow back street. At reception we were greeted by the owner. We had 4 bags and we are not young by any means. We were given our room key and instructed how to get to the 3rd floor. Firstly take a lift to the first floor with your luggage (no help offered or forthcoming) Then exit that lift and proceed to an elevator circa 1920s for the third floor. The probl;em with the cage lift is it is not large enough to take luggage and people. Eventually we made it to our room. Clean recent refurbishment. However,later, on inspecting the bar fridge, we noticed that the contents, water only was not cold. Further inspection revealed that the fridge had no wiring. On enquirng re the fridge, we were advised that it is a water storage cupboard. The next person on reception indicated that if we required tea or coffeee he would prepare it for us in the bar, adjacent to the restaurant. Later when we did ask he indicated that it would not be possible? The room itself whilst clean and tidy measured only 3.3 X 3.4 plus bathroom and a useless narrow hallway leading into the room. We attempted to use the internet at the hotel, however, the owner had great difficulty in the concept. Several other guests attempted to assist however, the keyboards are so old that the letters have been worn away. One of the better experiences at the hotel were the breakfasts, very good food and service. Towards the end of our stay i inadvertently caught the "cage" lift to the ground floor against instructions. I found myself in another hotel entry with an entirely different street entry. Location wise to the Terminii it is quite near. If you are prepared to accept that it is really a very very basic 3 star it is ok. After leaving,the memories are not quite as bad as when you are actually there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good TV and heat.”
Reviews.Author: wilsonjing
Reviews.Content: Pretty retro elevator that I have never seen in my life. Good staff can put your luggage during early morning arrival. The sensation of the door card is terrible, I have tried 10 times to open the door. One time the housekeeping forgot to put 2 packs of shampoo.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD LOCATION,GREAT HOTEL,STAFF ARE VERY NICE”
Reviews.Author: joner69
Reviews.Content: booked this trip through easyjet first time to italy,it was a suprise birthday trip for my wife,i booked the millini hotel,when we arrived hotel had problems with rooms,they offered us a sister hotel across the road the giogri hotel at first we were sad but after looking into the hotel giogri staff were very freindly rooms large and very nice and the location was great, next to the terminal station so very handy to jump on city sight seeing bus the best way to see rome,best weekend break i have had thanks to all the staff that had all the right infomation ready to give out,would book again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_in_Oz5
Reviews.Content: Staff were extemely helpful - right from the moment we arrived until we checked out. There was always a friendly welcome as we walked through reception in the morning and on our return to the hotel. Very helpful with sightseeing tips. Complimentary breakfast was very good - service in the breakfast room was again very good and there was always plenty of food. The only concern with the room was the airconditioning - you had to ring reception to get it switched on and off and it was extremely noisy. This may not have been such a problem had we not arrived in Rome in the middle of a heatwave. The bathroom was large and the shower had good water pressure, although it did take a while to adjust between hot and cold. We had no problems with the cleanliness of the room or bathroom. Good location - easy access to trains, buses and metro station. In regards to previous reveiws regarding taxis to the airport: the staff very clearly explained to us that they could book a private car to the airport for $55 or call a taxi in the morning (you can't book taxis) which was cost about $45-50 dollars. We took the taxi option - it came immediately on calling anyway. Would definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: va9nessa
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was big, clean, and comfortable. It is a little far from all of the sights and we had to use public transportation about 90% of the time. The staff was helpful in recommending places to eat and places to go. For the price paid for our stay this hotel was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A pretty ordinary experience”
Reviews.Author: Diablo1Adelaide
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife for 5 nights during the month of July. After travelling around Europe for a month and having great hotels to stay in, Hotel Giorgi was a letdown. We expected it to only be an average stay being a 3 star hotel, but it was worse. The bathroom was dirty and the shower filled up with water as the shower hole was completely blocked with pubic hair and was disgusting. The floor was dirty and the lift was extremely hot when it was 37 degrees outside. There was a strange old guy at night who gave out handwritten directions and recommendations of things to in Rome. There was also a guy who didn't really speak English who was there during the day. When I asked him to confirm a tour, the owner of Hotel Giorgi abused him in front of me in Italian and was then not allowed to confirm the tour for me which was very rude. A very ordinary experience with terrible customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cool and friendly”
Reviews.Author: BavariaRuss
Reviews.Content: This property is about a 5 minute walk from Termini- not on the St. Mary Major side, but on the other side. I walked from Termini and found it without a problem, was immediately greeted by the staff and shown to my air conditioned room, which was great as it was mid July and a bit intense outside. My room (single) consisted of a single bed with night table, desk area with chair, flat TV, area for my bag and hanging things up and a closet to hang my clothes equipped with a room safe. The bathroom was one of the best I have had in Rome, very updated, good size shower, sink area, etc- not the tiny, antiquated water closets that you often still find in Rome- very nice. The hotel has two public use computers with a wireless connection for internet. The breakfast was really great- self serve coffee, large variety of sweets rolls as well as crusty bread rolls with ham, cheese, etc. Also plenty of fresh fruit, yogurt, sliced veggies, etc. Was a lot more than I expected from a Rome hotel. I would definately return to the Giorgi, it was a welcome, quiet refuge in the hot, noisy, hustle and bustle of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “We love it!”
Reviews.Author: CALIFORNIA55
Reviews.Content: Lovely and clean hotel in few minutes to Termini Station. .Staff were very friendly and informative. We can certainly recommend this hotel and will use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelWigan
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews I was a bit apprehensive about staying here. Arrived after 3 hour delay at Manchester and 1 hour waiting for luggage. Outside of building a bit off putting but inside nice, clean and very welcoming. Went to our room and pleasently surprised. Breakfast good kept us going until lunch. Position of the hotel good if using the transport but we walked almost everywhere. Can understand why people get annoyed about the old man on reception at night as we got caught by him every night but you can either take it or leave it. We found him quite funny! Overall stay was great and would recommend to people if asked. The only thing that put me off Rome would be the graffiti everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable enough strange hotel”
Reviews.Author: NadsNDave
Reviews.Content: Pro's - Comfy bed, big bathroom, nice decor, windows (double glazed) opens onto street, friendly older gentleman at reception later at night who was full of useful information and had hand written notes for us regarding sightseeing/ transport/ resturants , his passion and enthusiasm saved this hotel (and hence our stay) from a much lower rating. good breakfast, close enough to most things (especially railway station) Con's - young guy at reception a bit inert, other old guy not much use - spends most of his time wandering around the block. Elevator best bypassed...use entry/ stairs from next door (faster and probably safer). bit of a dodgy area after dark (close to train station) personally had no issues but still cautious (most of rome a bit dodgy it seems)

Reviews.Title: “avoidable”
Reviews.Author: loonytraveller
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for one night since we had an early train to catch. the hotel is near the station, but is mysterious. the front desk and the first floor is reasonably decorated but then they take you behind the hotel and take you up a rather creepy lift, to the 5th floor where one wing had the other rooms. so half the hotel is in a wing, which seemed like a residential property, and immediately security seemed suspect. also, the hotel had a weird rule, where they insisted for our room keys when we left, and also asked us to lock our doors for security reasons. and there was no safe in the rooms! breakfast was decent, but would not stay here, since felt very creepy and unsecure. also when i asked for a taxi to the airport,was told that the costs would be 50 euros, for a private taxi, and then found out, that the standard fixed fare for the airport is 40 euros!! the front desk is run by an elderly person, who is very short tempered, and the rooms are minimalistic with clean bathrooms and hard mattresses. next to a church so you do get to hear the chimes every hour...

Reviews.Title: “horrible experiance!”
Reviews.Author: noshitsherlock11
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to stay 4 nights at this hotel, and when i arrived the owner seemed pretty nice. I was led up to my "room" and when i was finally left i alone i felt like crying. the shower was dirty, there was pubic(!) hair in the bathroom, the bed was dirty, floor was dirty, even the mirror was dirty. The towels were also dirty, and the shower looked like it hadn't been washed in years. I booked another hotel straight away, not believing what i just had seen. I couldn't check into my new hotel until the next day, and i was not able to sleep the whole night because i felt dirty for even being in the room. When i told the owner he suddenly did not want to speak english, yelling at me in italian, refusing to let me go without paying the whole amount for 4 days. One young cleaning lady came to my rescue and translated everything he said, and i led her up to the room, showing her how dirty it was, and she agreed with me. another cleaninglady came, probably the one who usually cleaned the room, and she started to yell at me for no reason. When we returned to the loddy she informed the owner of the dirtyness, and i was allowed to leave the hotel, but had to pay 70 euros for a room that probably wasn't worth more than max. 40. I wished to share my story here to warn people against the unfriendly personell and owner of the hotel. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Very hospitable front desk staff.”
Reviews.Author: BarrieIlovetotravel
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a one night stay after our cruise. We choose it because it was close to the trains and everything we wanted to see. We had been to Rome before and did not get to see the Pantheon, so we wanted to visit it. We arrived early and were told our room was not ready. They offered to put our luggage in a safe place for us. We had barely started moving the luggage when the woman at the desk informed us that she would drive us to another hotel and we could check in right away. The man helped move our stuff and we were driven to Hotel Lux, really nice lobby and the room was very European--comfortable with a spacious bathroom. We were very happy with the service we received. We did not pay anything extra and no one asked us for proof of payment. I had paid months before and kept proof of our reservation with payment. We did not see the rooms, only the lobby--which is small and very plain. Although we did not stay our experience was very positive.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT BUGHET HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: vagvl
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife for 5 nights during Christmas and really enjoyed it.Hotel is located next to terminal where all train and metro lines meet,and several bus lines start. Its also withing walking distance from many sites.The hotel is very clean although located in an old building with other hotels and offices but that is not problem ,except the old lift, which is a fun experience though.Rooms are cozy, clean, equipped with tv,small fridge,safe aircondition.Did not experience any noise problem during our stay.Staff was nice and helpfull.Room cost was 60 euro per day, early internet booking, and included a great buffet breakfast.Can't thing anything bad to say about the hotel unless you're looking for something really luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great basic room”
Reviews.Author: Melyner
Reviews.Content: This hotel served us well as our goal was to get out and see Rome all day, and then just sleep in the hotel. We had breakfast here everyday and enjoyed it...we were there for four breakfasts...it started getting a bit monotonous by then, but was still good. Pastries, fruit, yogurt, toast, cereal, etc. The room was clean and bigger than I thought it would be actually. The bed was comfortable enough. No real complaints. It is by Termini which is great for convenience as we carried our bags on the train and then to the hotel. It was scary at first as we arrived at night and there were some questionable individuals outside Termini, but we never wound up having any problems. And I'm probably a bit of a scaredy-cat when it comes to that, so it was fine. :) Really nice staff - we would stay here again, absolutely. Thanks Hotel Giorgi!

Reviews.Title: “Standard cheap Rome hotel.”
Reviews.Author: FrugalFly
Reviews.Content: Our room was canceled due to broken AC. We checked the room and it was a standard Rome hotel -- small twin beds in small room with old decor & wallpaper. Very small bad tv. Front desk old man was drunk or medicated, but he and the staff were okay. They had already moved our reservation to a similar hotel across from the train station. It is the standard cheap Rome hotel that you can expect for USD$100.00.

Reviews.Title: “Good price...good location...quite nice overall!”
Reviews.Author: JodoKast1221
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a couple of blocks from the Stazioni Termini and its within walking distance of most of the major tourist sites in central Rome. At night the area teetered on the edge of being sketchy but we had ne real problems or issues. I can see some people being uncomfortable walking around the streets near this hotel at night! The hotel rooms are quite nice and came complete with free bottled water that was restocked daily! The view from our room was nothing great as it overlooked other rooms although you could see a gold statue on the top of a building just over the hotel roof! The elevator should probably be replaced. Its small, super old and rickety but quite the adventure still! This hotel is great value based on what we paid for a room and the location!

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable and affordable location in the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: globe2trotter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the 3-star Hotel Giorgi when we travelled to Rome in September 2009. The hotel is situated on Via Magenta just less than 5 mins walk from Termini station and approx. 50mins from Fiumicino airport (for international flights), which is convenient especially if your arrival is late at night. Getting there Take the Leonardo Express from Fiumicino to Termini for 11 Euro per person (30mins) or take the regional train from Fiumicino to Ostiense and change to metro (Piramide) to get to Termini for 6.5 Euro altogether. This takes 50mins, but it's very well signposted and easy to find your way to get to Rome city centre. The regional trains run more often than Leonardo express which comes at every 30 mins. When you arrive at Termini, you need to train right at the exit and cross the car parks and a main street to get to Piazza della Indipendenza. Via Magenta is on the first street to your right. On arrival On arrival, we were greeted by an old Italian man at the reception desk. You will need to show your passport and fill in the necessary paperwork to check-in. The old man proceeded to tell us in good, but rather fast(!) english about all the best places to visit in Rome, what to avoid and recommended places to eat. It was rather amusing to follow, but it makes for a nice welcome! He'd also gives you a city map of Rome that marks out all the main attractions to see in Rome. Our room We were given a twin bed room on the first-floor, which easily slept four. The rooms have been recently refurbished and looks quite modern. It has a large ensuite bathroom with a basin, two toilets (normal for Europe) and a shower. You'd get given towels - these are quite thin and seems a bit like tablecloths, so you may find it is not sufficient for your use if you are used to using soft and thicker towels. We'd also found that where you stand in the shower it was a bit blocked, leaving you standing in a puddle whilst having a shower so the plumbing system is not so good. The room had a TV (all Italian channels) and a fridge cabinet underneath. You'd get given free bottles of complimentary mineral water. There was a walk-in wardrobe in our room where a safe was also available. There was a telephone to call the receptionist and acted as an alarm if you requested the reception to wake you up at a certain time. It also has the usual dressing table and a small dining table. There was air-conditioning in the room, but it is centrally operated and you needed to ask the receptionist to switch it on. The air conitioning when it was on made the room quite comfortable to sleep in - not too hot or cold, but you do need to get use to the noise at first. The view There's not much to look at outside. Our room faced the street, which was surprisingly quiet despite being near to the main hub of the city. Each morning we got woken up by the sound of church bells, but I think this is inevitable as Rome is full of churches! Breakfast The breakfast room is on the first floor past the lounge area. The breakfast bar was small, but it consisted of a continental buffet of cheese, ham slices, pastries, bread, yoghurt, selection of cereals, juices and fruit - pretty basic, but enough to fill you up with a full stomach until lunchtime. The staff were very friendly and brought you tea or coffee. You would need to get there at least half an hour before the breakfast finishes at 10am (opens 7am), because otherwise you'd might find that there's not much choice of breakfast left. Getting around As mentioned before, the hotel is conveniently located near Termini train station, which is also the main bus station that serves the city centre and surrounding areas. It is also relatively within easy walking distance to the main sights in Rome (that's located in the North East section or Colosseum and the Roman Forum. For example, it takes approx 20mins to walk to the Colosseum. It costs 1 Eur for a ticket lasting 75 mins to travel on any metro or bus routes. Local eatery There are lots of eating places around the hotel because it is situated near to Termini. Invariably if you eat at the station (mainly fast food, including McDonald's) it is a little more expensive. The receptionist recommended Florian's Cafe, which is located on Piazza della Indipendenza just round the corner from the hotel. We went there on two nights and enjoyed the meals. You can get a pasta and secondi, plus water, for two for 25-30 Euro. Local amenities Apart from those just mentioned, there's a BNL Paribas bank on Via Cavour that takes Visa cards and you could withdraw money. Most of the shops are in Termini and you could get an international telephone card from the Tobacconist stores. Checking out We'd just handed our key card at the reception desk (you'd also need to do this everything you leave i.e. go out of the hotel; even if you are just stepping outside to buy something! And pick it back up when you go back). You could leave your luggage in a small room, which is locked, if you still have a bit more of a day to spend in Rome before catching your flight. Overall impression We'd enjoyed our stay immensely and would recommend it to anyone who doesn't mind forgoing a bit of luxury, and just want a comfortable and convenient place to stay, whilst on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for seeing rome”
Reviews.Author: teacherstravelling
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a perfect base for seeing the sights of rome. The hotel is very close to the termini station so you can get around the city on their undergraound systems or buses. Hotel is quite simple and no frills, but if that's all you're after, perfect. It is cheap and the breakfast was actually quite nice. Staff were helpful and the location is just ideal for walking around Rome. Tips - get a guided tour of the Sistine Chapel. Not too much more expensive and well worth it. There is a fantastic little pizzeria just off Via Nazionale opposite the Forum area on the left hand side as you walk up the road. Its in a little alleyway and is cheap but excellent food. Spend most evenings around the Fonatana di Trevi area - just breathtaking and sooo buzzing with activity. Best tip for food is to go to the main piazza or place you want to be and then just walk out on one of the roads and turn a corner - that's where the best restaurants (populated by locals rather than just tourists) actually are. Don't bother with the open air bus trips - get your walking shoes out and just go for it. Plan your day and you'll see everything and so much more.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Chazeroo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Giorgi for 3 nights on our first trip to Rome last week. After reading some bad reviews about the hotel I felt that I had to give a review as our stay was very enjoyable. On approaching the hotel for the first time I must admit I wasnt sure as the street looked a little off the beaten track, but inside the hotel was nicely decorated and our room was a perfect size. The staff we had were very friendly especially the very entertaining 'Mr Information' who did the night shifts! Breakfast was good and the location was fantastic. We walked everywhere but the hotel is very close to the train station and buses and metro. All in all a great holiday and I would not hesitate to go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't book the hotel again...”
Reviews.Author: hippiehege
Reviews.Content: We arrived pretty late (2230), came with a flight from Oslo. Me, my son and my mum. I had ordered and paid the hotel in march. When we arrived the receptionist (who I think was blind or something) couldn't find our name on his list... his written list, he didn't even have a computer!!! Anyway, after a little discussion (me in english, he in italian) he gave us room anyway. The room was terrible small, and we paid just as much each nigth here as in Sheraton Rome later this vacation - and the difference were HUGE!! Wouldn't recommend this for anyone - it must be many hotels which is much better in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Clean and Convenient Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SandstormLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for al ong weekend on our first trip to Rome. Hotel is perfectly located next to termini station wit the tubes and lots of bus stops. Hotel itself was cleam, staff really friendly and helpful. The rooms are "basic" but they are clean and good sized. We stayed on 1st floor though which sounds like it is better than the 3rd. For the money I would definatley recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Bill_Maltby
Reviews.Content: Our Valentines’ treat began really well with excellent flights courtesy of KLM which began from Leeds-Bradford Airport, changed at Amsterdam and finally on to Rome where we landed at 9.30pm. Our taxi pick-up was waiting, as arranged with our names on a board, and we were transferred to our hotel, the Giorgi. As we were checking in it became apparent that things had now gone incredibly wrong. The night receptionist, who was very helpful in informing us about places to go and things to see, told us that we had been booked in to two single rooms. We told him that we had booked a double room (why would a married couple celebrating Valentines Day in Rome want single rooms?) He told us that he could not supply us with a double room that evening and we would have to spend Valentines night in single rooms. He would sort it out in the morning. We went tour rooms which were 16m apart and began carrying clothes from room to room because we had only taken one suitcase. We awoke very early the next morning and asked about changing to a double room for the remainder of our stay. We were told it would be impossible to change rooms because the hotel was full. We would be able to change for our 3rd night. We telephoned Expedia, who promised to follow the matter up straight away and telephone back. They did not sort out the problem, nor did they phone back. On our third day we again asked to change rooms. The reception chap again said it was impossible because the hotel was full. My wife lost her temper at this, explained that our luggage had not been unpacked for three days because we were waiting for a room swap. At this point, and probably because of all of the broken promises, the receptionist said that he would give us a double room. He gave us the keys to a room that had just been vacated and told us we could move our case into the room. The room was lovely but the incompetence of the receptionists at the Georgi Hotel had spoilt our break. Rome is incredible. Don’t spoil YOUR visit by staying at the Hotel Giorgi.

Reviews.Title: “recommend for a short break”
Reviews.Author: ArchieNorthEast
Reviews.Content: read a few reviews about the giorgi being clean, friendly and comfortable and perfectly located for walking round the sights in rome - they were all 100% correct. A perfect base when spending most of your time out and about but also pleasurable the time you're there. welcoming, friendly and helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: cfrydj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Giorgi for 4 nights this past August, and overall had a positive experience. The staff (one guy in particular was there almost all the time, I swear he never slept) was very friendly and helpful. We arrived early in the morning on the first day and left in the evening on the last day, but they were very accomodating with storing our luggage and letting us hang out in the air conditioned lobby during the heat of the day (Rome is scorching in August). Our room had air conditioning, we just had to phone to the front desk to turn it on. We had a TV and a fridge, and lots of space in our room. The elevator was one of those rickety old things you see on the movies, and didn't work if people didn't close the door properly, but most of the time it worked fine. The location was great, with the Stazione Termini only a couple of minutes away. From there we could ride the train, or more conveniently in Rome, the bus. We even discovered as the trip went on that we could walk most places in about a half hour or so. The breakfast was good, and there was lots of food. There's also a supermarket just about a block away to buy snacks, water, etc. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: greent
Reviews.Content: Two minutes from Rome Terminii, Metro and bus station so easy to go anywhere in Rome and further afield Hotel was clean and the rooms comfortable. The staff were very helpful. Breakfast was above the norm for the class of Italian hotel although more and more Italian hotels are providing better choice than the coffee and rolls or old. Only minor complaint was that the two breakfast staff could be overwhelmed with keeping the buffett topped up and serving coffee and tea especially when the breakfast room was full

Reviews.Title: “A unfortunate stay in room 303”
Reviews.Author: Lucytwo259
Reviews.Content: If you check the website for the Giorgi, you will find a picture of a charming room nicely decorated and very appealing. We did not have that room. As earlier reviewers have noted, room 303 is in an older part of the hotel and in serious need of renovation. There is no carpet on the floor, the wallpaper is starting to come off the walls, and the shower is broken. When we arrived at 2:30 in the afternoon, the room was not ready (which we were not told until we had hauled our luggage up in the ancient closet-like elevator). We did gain access to the room to leave our luggage. The room had an unpleasant odor coming from the bathroom. Fortunately, when we returned and the room was clean and the odor was gone. If you check out the hotel on Expedia, you will see that the Hotel advertises things such as Climate Control, High Speed Internet, and Bathrobes. The front desk controlled the air-conditioning. There was one computer near the breakfast room for the use of the entire hotel, which costs 2 euro/half hour. On the second day of our stay, we returned to the room to find that my husband's robe (his personal robe--not one provided by the hotel) was missing. Evidently, housekeeping removed it with the dirty towels. No one knew what happened to it and no one cared. Will we stay there again? I think not. This was an expensive hotel and did not come up to the standards of the supposed lesser hotels we stayed at in Nice, Venice, and Florence. Although it was very conveniently located near the train station and metro, I would prefer a hotel more on the outskirts of Rome next time.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel...Little lacking in the service but great location”
Reviews.Author: jry-i
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel with a great location. The staff is a little less than excited about doing anything for you . Not rude but you must ask-they are not going to offer anything.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: millie32
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in this Hotel which was very well located 2 streets from the Termini station, the Terravision bus from Ciampino Airport drops you right at the station. A lift takes you to the first floor where the bar & breakfast room are then another old but quaint lift takes you to the upper floors, Our room was on the 5th floor and was really spacious with 2 double beds and was very clean, 2 big windows at either end of the room but not any great view from either but this did not matter. Breakfast was O.K, usual ham cheese toast cereal etc Downside was the surly Reception staff , 2 older gentleman who did not seem to be very friendly and did not speak or understand English very well. also the bar was not manned at all & we were told to contact the Reception staff if we needed a drink but we did not try this as we did not think they would be well pleased ! Area round the Hotel seemed safe enough (we were 2 woman on our own) and there were restaurants nearby, even had a meal in the Termini station which was full of shops & snack bars. Would recommend for its central position

Reviews.Title: “A glorified hostel”
Reviews.Author: Lisa2306
Reviews.Content: Stayed here w/ mom and sister for 1 night on our way back to the U.S. from Rome. Room 303, 1 queen bed, 1 twin. 2.5 blocks from the train station. Room was large but very basic. Bidet emitted strong stench of urine that spread into the room. We covered it with several towels, which helped. I gather that Rome hotels are extremely expensive for what you get, but this place was up there with some of the nastiest hostels I have stayed in in Europe and Central America for $100 less. Funny photos of someone's cat on the wall. Evening clerk was very friendly - escorted us to our room and helped us with our luggage. Morning clerk was worthless, seemed drunk or asleep, took repeated requests of "tassi, per favore" for him to figure out that we wanted him to call us a taxi. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great position, excellent condition love Rome.”
Reviews.Author: GeordieJimmy
Reviews.Content: As a regular visitor to Rome, have stayed in a variety of accommodation, but the Giorgi this spring was my favourite so far. Small unasuming place, decent value for money, it is literally one hundred yards from where the Ryanair bus drops you off or takes you back to Ciampino. The rooms where really nice, simple with no excessive luxury, but well maintained and furnished and spotlessly clean. Breakfast was nothing special, rarelly is in Rome, so we moslty have a quick snack and enjoy a 'second breakfast' in one of the Cafes in the area. Was initially worried about it being a little suspect so close to the station, but the Hotel is next to a Piazza that seemd o be policed 24hrs a day due to some government office or other. Great Location, and not a squalid hotel one would expect so close to the station.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: joyce_48
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last year for 2 nights, September, 2006. It is located walking distance near the Roma Termini Train station and has helpful staff. The rooms are clean and adequate for the price and seem to be redecorated recently. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Scary elevator new interior”
Reviews.Author: bpotts3
Reviews.Content: Giorgi Hotel centrally located walking distance from the Termini train station. Beautiful interior, and remodeled rooms. Room was large, A/C had to be turned on by front desk, bed was 2 fulls shoved together to make a king, huge bathroom and small balcony. Overall quiet, but building is shared with another 2 star hotel and only access to floors 3 -5 are via a very scary freight elevator. Wish we had paid for the 4 star place, but for the money $95 EURO, it was worth it, just barely.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Giorgi
HotelInfo.Address: Via Magenta 11, 00185 Rome, Italy
